refnamediv.refpurpose: Convert a binary string into a real.

listitem.para: a 1-by-1 matrix of strings, the binary code. The length of code must be binlen.
a 1-by-1 matrix of doubles, integer value, positive, the number of bits in the binary string, i.e. the length of code.
a 1-by-d or d-by-1 matrix of doubles, the maximum bounds of the parameters
a 1-by-d or d-by-1 matrix of doubles, the minimum bounds of the parameters
a d-by-1 matrix of doubles, the real numbers corresponding to x.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Convert the dimension d binary string encoded in code into the real x. On output, the argument y is in the range [minbound,maxbound].
The bits in code are organized in d blocks of binlen bits. In other words, the bits in code are the concatenation of the bits of each dimensions.
